channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: QNCD: Quantization Noise Correction for Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion models have revolutionized image synthesis, setting new benchmarks in quality and creativity.

item.title: Lane-Change in Dense Traffic with Model Predictive Control and Neural Networks
item.description: This paper presents an online smooth-path lane-change control framework.

item.title: MPXGAT: An Attention based Deep Learning Model for Multiplex Graphs Embedding
item.description: Graph representation learning has rapidly emerged as a pivotal field of study.

item.title: NaijaHate: Evaluating Hate Speech Detection on Nigerian Twitter Using Representative Data
item.description: To address the global issue of hateful content proliferating in online platforms, hate speech detection (HSD) models are typically developed on datasets collected in the United States, thereby failing to generalize to English dialects from the Majority World.

item.title: Towards Multimodal Video Paragraph Captioning Models Robust to Missing Modality
item.description: Video paragraph captioning (VPC) involves generating detailed narratives for long videos, utilizing supportive modalities such as speech and event boundaries.

item.title: Uncovering Misattributed Suicide Causes through Annotation Inconsistency Detection in Death Investigation Notes
item.description: Data accuracy is essential for scientific research and policy development.

item.title: Change-Agent: Towards Interactive Comprehensive Change Interpretation and Analysis from Change Detection and Change Captioning
item.description: Monitoring changes in the Earth's surface is crucial for understanding natural processes and human impacts, necessitating precise and comprehensive interpretation methodologies.

item.title: CAT: Exploiting Inter-Class Dynamics for Domain Adaptive Object Detection
item.description: We propose Class-Aware Teacher (CAT) to address the class bias issue in the domain adaptation setting.

item.title: CLAP4CLIP: Continual Learning with Probabilistic Finetuning for Vision-Language Models
item.description: The deterministic nature of the existing finetuning methods makes them overlook the many possible interactions across the modalities and deems them unsafe for high-risk CL tasks requiring reliable uncertainty estimation.

item.title: SineNet: Learning Temporal Dynamics in Time-Dependent Partial Differential Equations
item.description: While the U-Net architecture with skip connections is commonly used by prior studies to enable multi-scale processing, our analysis shows that the need for features to evolve across layers results in temporally misaligned features in skip connections, which limits the model's performance.

item.title: Total-Decom: Decomposed 3D Scene Reconstruction with Minimal Interaction
item.description: Scene reconstruction from multi-view images is a fundamental problem in computer vision and graphics.

item.title: Situation Awareness for Driver-Centric Driving Style Adaptation
item.description: Furthermore, we found that feature encoders pretrained on our dataset lead to more precise driving behavior modeling.

item.title: Burst Super-Resolution with Diffusion Models for Improving Perceptual Quality
item.description: In our proposed method, on the other hand, burst LR features are used to reconstruct the initial burst SR image that is fed into an intermediate step in the diffusion model.

item.title: Swarm Characteristics Classification Using Neural Networks
item.description: This article presents a study on using supervised neural network time series classification (NN TSC) to predict key attributes and tactics of swarming autonomous agents for military contexts.

item.title: GeoAuxNet: Towards Universal 3D Representation Learning for Multi-sensor Point Clouds
item.description: In this paper, we propose geometry-to-voxel auxiliary learning to enable voxel representations to access point-level geometric information, which supports better generalisation of the voxel-based backbone with additional interpretations of multi-sensor point clouds.

item.title: GraphAD: Interaction Scene Graph for End-to-end Autonomous Driving
item.description: With the representation of the ISG, the driving agents aggregate essential information from the most influential elements, including the road agents with potential collisions and the map elements to follow.

item.title: Enhance Image Classification via Inter-Class Image Mixup with Diffusion Model
item.description: Text-to-image (T2I) generative models have recently emerged as a powerful tool, enabling the creation of photo-realistic images and giving rise to a multitude of applications.

item.title: MineLand: Simulating Large-Scale Multi-Agent Interactions with Limited Multimodal Senses and Physical Needs
item.description: Conventional multi-agent simulators often assume perfect information and limitless capabilities, hindering the ecological validity of social interactions.

item.title: Towards Temporally Consistent Referring Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Referring Video Object Segmentation (R-VOS) methods face challenges in maintaining consistent object segmentation due to temporal context variability and the presence of other visually similar objects.

item.title: DenseNets Reloaded: Paradigm Shift Beyond ResNets and ViTs
item.description: This paper revives Densely Connected Convolutional Networks (DenseNets) and reveals the underrated effectiveness over predominant ResNet-style architectures.

item.title: KazSAnDRA: Kazakh Sentiment Analysis Dataset of Reviews and Attitudes
item.description: This paper presents KazSAnDRA, a dataset developed for Kazakh sentiment analysis that is the first and largest publicly available dataset of its kind.

item.title: Debiasing Cardiac Imaging with Controlled Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: Notably, we conduct all our experiments using a single, consumer-level GPU to highlight the feasibility of our approach within resource-constrained environments.

item.title: OmniParser: A Unified Framework for Text Spotting, Key Information Extraction and Table Recognition
item.description: Recently, visually-situated text parsing (VsTP) has experienced notable advancements, driven by the increasing demand for automated document understanding and the emergence of Generative Large Language Models (LLMs) capable of processing document-based questions.

item.title: Metric Learning from Limited Pairwise Preference Comparisons
item.description: We study whether the metric can still be recovered, even though it is known that learning individual ideal items is now no longer possible.

item.title: Flexible Analysis of Individual Heterogeneity in Event Studies: Application to the Child Penalty
item.description: Third, we use the individual-level estimates as a regressor on the right-hand side to study the intergenerational elasticity of the CP between mothers and daughters.

item.title: A Robust Ensemble Algorithm for Ischemic Stroke Lesion Segmentation: Generalizability and Clinical Utility Beyond the ISLES Challenge
item.description: We address this gap by presenting a novel ensemble algorithm derived from the 2022 Ischemic Stroke Lesion Segmentation (ISLES) challenge.

item.title: Maximum Likelihood Estimation on Stochastic Blockmodels for Directed Graph Clustering
item.description: This paper studies the directed graph clustering problem through the lens of statistics, where we formulate clustering as estimating underlying communities in the directed stochastic block model (DSBM).

item.title: RTracker: Recoverable Tracking via PN Tree Structured Memory
item.description: Upon the PN tree memory, we develop corresponding walking rules for determining the state of the target and define a set of control flows to unite the tracker and the detector in different tracking scenarios.

item.title: Improving Adversarial Data Collection by Supporting Annotators: Lessons from GAHD, a German Hate Speech Dataset
item.description: Our experiments show that the resulting dataset is challenging even for state-of-the-art hate speech detection models, and that training on GAHD clearly improves model robustness.

item.title: A diverse Multilingual News Headlines Dataset from around the World
item.description: Babel Briefings is a novel dataset featuring 4. 7 million news headlines from August 2020 to November 2021, across 30 languages and 54 locations worldwide with English translations of all articles included.

item.title: Fine-Tuning Language Models with Reward Learning on Policy
item.description: RLHF contains three steps, i. e., human preference collecting, reward learning, and policy optimization, which are usually performed serially.

item.title: Model Stock: All we need is just a few fine-tuned models
item.description: This paper introduces an efficient fine-tuning method for large pre-trained models, offering strong in-distribution (ID) and out-of-distribution (OOD) performance.

item.title: Improving Clinical NLP Performance through Language Model-Generated Synthetic Clinical Data
item.description: Generative models have been showing potential for producing data in mass.

item.title: An Interactive Human-Machine Learning Interface for Collecting and Learning from Complex Annotations
item.description: Human-Computer Interaction has been shown to lead to improvements in machine learning systems by boosting model performance, accelerating learning and building user confidence.

item.title: Human-compatible driving partners through data-regularized self-play reinforcement learning
item.description: Therefore, incorporating realistic human agents is essential for scalable training and evaluation of autonomous driving systems in simulation.

item.title: Phonetic Segmentation of the UCLA Phonetics Lab Archive
item.description: We also discuss the utility of the VoxAngeles corpus for general research and pedagogy in crosslinguistic phonetics, as well as for low-resource and multilingual speech technologies.

item.title: SG-PGM: Partial Graph Matching Network with Semantic Geometric Fusion for 3D Scene Graph Alignment and Its Downstream Tasks
item.description: The alignment between 3D scene graphs is the first step of many downstream tasks such as scene graph aided point cloud registration, mosaicking, overlap checking, and robot navigation.

item.title: Detecting Financial Bots on the Ethereum Blockchain
item.description: In this study, we present a novel approach that utilizes machine learning for the detection of financial bots on the Ethereum platform.

item.title: Dataverse: Open-Source ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Pipeline for Large Language Models
item.description: To address the challenges associated with data processing at scale, we propose Dataverse, a unified open-source Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipeline for large language models (LLMs) with a user-friendly design at its core.

item.title: Sparse Feature Circuits: Discovering and Editing Interpretable Causal Graphs in Language Models
item.description: We introduce methods for discovering and applying sparse feature circuits.

item.title: KazParC: Kazakh Parallel Corpus for Machine Translation
item.description: We introduce KazParC, a parallel corpus designed for machine translation across Kazakh, English, Russian, and Turkish.

item.title: Semantic Map-based Generation of Navigation Instructions
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach to navigation instruction generation by framing the problem as an image captioning task using semantic maps as visual input.

item.title: SA-GS: Scale-Adaptive Gaussian Splatting for Training-Free Anti-Aliasing
item.description: This integration is actually a limiting case of super-sampling, which significantly improves anti-aliasing performance over vanilla Gaussian Splatting.

item.title: Emergent predictability in microbial ecosystems
item.description: Here, we propose an information-theoretic framework for defining, nuancing and quantifying emergent simplicity in empirical data based on the ability of simple models to predict community-level functional properties.

item.title: Instance-Adaptive and Geometric-Aware Keypoint Learning for Category-Level 6D Object Pose Estimation
item.description: (2) The second design is a Geometric-Aware Feature Aggregation module, which can efficiently integrate the local and global geometric information into keypoint features.

item.title: Are Large Language Models Good at Utility Judgments?
item.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is considered to be a promising approach to alleviate the hallucination issue of large language models (LLMs), and it has received widespread attention from researchers recently.

item.title: Low-Rank Rescaled Vision Transformer Fine-Tuning: A Residual Design Approach
item.description: Parameter-efficient fine-tuning for pre-trained Vision Transformers aims to adeptly tailor a model to downstream tasks by learning a minimal set of new adaptation parameters while preserving the frozen majority of pre-trained parameters.

item.title: Taming Lookup Tables for Efficient Image Retouching
item.description: Existing enhancement models often optimize for high performance while falling short of reducing hardware inference time and power consumption, especially on edge devices with constrained computing and storage resources.

item.title: RecDiffusion: Rectangling for Image Stitching with Diffusion Models
item.description: Image stitching from different captures often results in non-rectangular boundaries, which is often considered unappealing.

item.title: Segmentation tool for images of cracks
item.description: Machine learning algorithms can be used for augmenting the capability of classical visual inspection of bridge structures, however, the implementation of such an algorithm requires a massive annotated training dataset, which is time-consuming to produce.
